meta.notes: Example dataset with 10 requirements demonstrating all requirement fields, edge types, enums, solutionOptions, and solvedBy solutions.

requirements.title: Multi-Location Inventory Management
requirements.description: System shall manage inventory across multiple warehouse locations including Mesquite, TX and Livonia, GA.

provenance.sourceRef: UYB Meeting Notes - Inventory and Assembly Process Review

sourceLocator.quote: We have two warehouses: Mesquite and Livonia. We need NetSuite to show what's where and to move stock between them.

followUpQuestions: Do you need bin-level tracking within each warehouse?
What is the transfer order process between locations?
Are there location-specific costs or pricing rules?
How should fulfillment location be determined (closest, primary, manual)?
Are any locations third-party logistics (3PL)?

steps: Configure Mesquite, TX and Livonia, GA as inventory locations
Set up Transfer Order process for inter-location moves
Configure location assignment rules on sales orders

solutionOptions.title: Native locations + Transfer Orders
solutionOptions.description: Use standard NetSuite inventory locations with Transfer Orders for inter-location moves; optionally use allocation rules for fulfillment location selection.
cons: May require process discipline for transfers
risks: If users bypass transfers, on-hand by location will drift

decision.rationale: Baseline option pending confirmation of bin requirements.

followUpQuestions: Do you require wave picking or directed picking?
Do you need location-specific reorder points?
references: Internal: UYB Inventory SOP draft v0.3

solutionOptions.title: Locations + 3PL as virtual location
solutionOptions.description: Represent the 3PL as a virtual location and use transfer/ownership process controls to track stock at the provider.
cons: Virtual location can hide operational nuance

edges.note: Website inventory sync needs location-level ATP.
Consignment may be tracked as a virtual location.

requirements.title: E-commerce Inventory Availability Sync
requirements.description: System shall expose real-time or near-real-time inventory availability to the e-commerce storefront by location and overall.

sourceLocator.quote: If the website says it's in stock and then we can't fulfill, it blows up CS. We need accurate availability—ideally by warehouse.

followUpQuestions: Which storefront platform(s) are in scope?
Do you need location-level availability on the product page?
What is the acceptable latency (seconds, minutes, hourly)?
Should backorders be allowed when availability is zero?
Are there allocation or reservation rules to apply?

steps: Define availability rules (ATP vs. on-hand vs. available-to-promise)
Select integration pattern (webhooks, scheduled sync, middleware)
Map item identifiers and location identifiers

solutionOptions.title: Middleware-driven near-real-time sync
solutionOptions.description: Use middleware to consume NetSuite item/location availability changes and push updates to storefront APIs.

decision.rationale: Need monitoring and retries; internal team already runs middleware.

solutionOptions.title: Scheduled availability export (batch)
solutionOptions.description: Export availability to SFTP/HTTP feed every N minutes; storefront ingests feed.

implementation.notes: Availability computed as On Hand - Committed; pushed to storefront every 60s with retries + dead-letter queue.

edges.note: Location-level inventory must exist before syncing.

requirements.title: Vendor Bill Approval Controls
requirements.description: System shall support approval of vendor bills prior to posting/payment based on amount thresholds and approver roles.

sourceLocator.quote: We need approval on vendor bills over $5k, and some invoices need 2 people to sign off.

followUpQuestions: What are the approval thresholds (by amount, vendor, subsidiary, department)?
Do approvals need to be sequential or can they be concurrent?
Do you need delegation, out-of-office rules, or reassignments?
Should approvals be required before GL impact or only before payment?
Do approvers need visibility into supporting documents?

steps: Select approval mechanism (custom fields, SuiteFlow workflow, custom records + script)

solutionOptions.title: Custom fields + task queue
solutionOptions.description: Add custom approval status/approver fields and route approvals through a controlled task queue (e.g., custom record or task assignments).

solutionOptions.title: SuiteFlow multi-stage workflow with concurrent approvers
solutionOptions.description: Use a workflow to manage states (Pending, Approved, Rejected) with parallel approvals and threshold-based routing.
cons: Complex parallel logic can get hard to reason about

solutionOptions.title: Custom approval metadata records
solutionOptions.description: Create custom records to store approval routing rules and history; use script to evaluate and update transactions.

edges.note: Approval notifications may use the email template standards.

requirements.title: Assembly Build at Specific Locations
requirements.description: System shall support assembly builds occurring at designated locations and consuming components from that location’s inventory.

provenance.sourceRef: UYB Meeting Notes - Inventory and Assembly Process Review

sourceLocator.quote: We assemble kits in Mesquite, but sometimes Livonia does small runs. Components should come from the right warehouse.

followUpQuestions: Do you require work orders or simple assembly builds?
Do you need labor/overhead costing captured?
Are builds backflushed or manually issued?
Do you need build-to-order on sales orders?
designProposal: Confirm assembly item list and component BOM accuracy
Train operations on build transactions and reversals

edges.note: Assembly build requires location inventory accuracy.
Availability sync must account for assemblies at each location.

requirements.title: Role-Based Access for Inventory Transactions
requirements.description: System shall restrict inventory adjustments and transfers to authorized roles and maintain an audit trail of changes.

sourceLocator.quote: Inventory adjustments must be limited to supervisors; all changes must be auditable.

followUpQuestions: Which roles can create adjustments vs. approve adjustments?
Are there segregation-of-duties constraints (create vs. post)?
Do you need alerts for high-value adjustments?

steps: Define least-privilege roles for adjustments, transfers, and receipts
Create saved searches for adjustment monitoring

solutionOptions.title: Native permissions + monitoring searches
solutionOptions.description: Use NetSuite roles/permissions and enable monitoring via saved searches and system notes.
cons: Alerts may require additional scripting or workflow

implementation.notes: Created Inventory Supervisor role; restricted Inventory Adjustment and Transfer Order permissions; deployed monitoring saved searches.

edges.note: Location processes must align with role controls.

requirements.title: Standardized Email Templates for Operational Notifications
requirements.description: System shall use standardized email templates for approvals, shipment notices, and exception alerts.

sourceLocator.quote: Consistent emails reduce confusion. We want standard templates for key operational messages.

followUpQuestions: Which events need notifications (approvals, fulfillment, billing, exceptions)?
Who are recipients (internal, customer, vendor)?
Do templates need branding per subsidiary?

solutionOptions.title: Central template catalog + governance
solutionOptions.description: Maintain a controlled set of templates and require change review before edits.

decision.rationale: Replaced by customer’s corporate comms system standard.

edges.note: Approval notifications should follow template standards.
Incident alerts may share template components.

requirements.title: Near-Zero Downtime Cutover Plan
requirements.description: Project shall deliver a cutover plan that minimizes operational downtime to under 4 hours during go-live weekend.

sourceLocator.quote: We can't stop shipping for a full day. Plan for a cutover that keeps downtime under four hours.

followUpQuestions: What is the shipping blackout window that is acceptable?
Are there integrations that can lag behind cutover?
Do you need parallel run for financials?
designProposal: Define freeze windows per function (AP, AR, shipping, purchasing)
Execute mock cutovers and measure duration
Create rollback plan and data reconciliation checklist

edges.note: Data migration sequence impacts cutover timeline.

requirements.title: Historical Transaction Migration Scope
requirements.description: System shall migrate 24 months of historical transactions for reporting, including orders, fulfillments, invoices, and payments.

sourceLocator.quote: We don't need 10 years, but we want two years of transactions in NetSuite so reports don't look empty.

followUpQuestions: Which transaction types are required (SO, IF, INV, CM, PAY)?
Is the requirement for analytics only or operational drill-through?
What are acceptable data quality thresholds and reconciliation rules?
Do you require source-system document images migrated?

steps: Confirm transaction scope and cutover date
Build migration pipelines and reconciliation reports

solutionOptions.title: Full operational migration (24 months)
solutionOptions.description: Load full transactions with links (SO→IF→INV→PAY) to support drill-down and operational queries.

solutionOptions.title: Summarized historical GL + open transactions only
solutionOptions.description: Load summarized GL balances and only open operational transactions; keep historical operational detail in a reporting warehouse.

edges.note: Migration plan and duration directly affect cutover downtime.
Migration monitoring may generate incident alerts.

requirements.title: Consignment Stock Visibility
requirements.description: System shall track consigned inventory separately from owned inventory and report consignment balances by location.

provenance.sourceRef: UYB Meeting Notes - Inventory and Assembly Process Review

sourceLocator.quote: We might do consignment in the future, but it's not in the next six months.

followUpQuestions: Is consignment currently active or future-state only?
Do you need ownership tracking at the lot/serial level?
How will settlement and billing work for consigned goods?

steps: Defer until consignment program is approved by business

solutionOptions.title: Virtual location for consignment
solutionOptions.description: Model consignment as a separate location and use process controls to prevent commingling with owned stock.

edges.note: Consignment would likely be modeled as an additional location.

requirements.title: Automated Incident Alerts for Integration Failures
requirements.description: System shall notify IT within 5 minutes of integration failures and provide a diagnostic payload for triage.

sourceLocator.quote: We require alerts for failed jobs within 5 minutes and want the payload/stack trace attached or linkable.

followUpQuestions: What alert channels are required (email, SMS, Slack, PagerDuty)?
What constitutes a failure (HTTP 5xx, retries exhausted, schema mismatch)?
Do you need correlation IDs to trace across systems?
What is the on-call schedule and escalation policy?

steps: Define failure conditions and alert routing
Add correlation IDs and link to logs

solutionOptions.title: PagerDuty + structured event payload
solutionOptions.description: Publish failures to PagerDuty with structured details and a link to the raw payload in the error store.

implementation.notes: Alert dispatcher posts to PagerDuty; error store retains last 30 days; correlation IDs included.

edges.note: Alerts must be wired into the chosen integration approach.
Alerts may share standardized template components.
